Article 1: The contest is opened to the students of the universities and French and foreign universities practitioner the music on a purely basis amateur and old of less than 30 years to January 1, 2009.

Article 2: The inscription will have to be accompanied of a justifying official document of the membership of one of the authorized establishments.

Article 3: The inscriptions will be closed on January 10, 2009 at midnight.

Article 4: The expenses of inscription are of 50 euros per candidate.

Article 5: The number of candidates is limited to 30 for the first test. If the number of inscriptions was exceeded, on January 10, 2009, the organizers reserve the possibility pre-of auditioning the candidates for l' d' helps; an audio support (recording of a work different from the program of the contest).

Article 6: Any candidate having already taken part in the contest can contribute again to l' exception of the first prices of the previous years. However, the candidates will not be able to in no case to reach more l' twice; final test with orchestra. Finalists of the contest of the previous year - and only in this case of figure - reach directly the semi-finals. No candidate will be able to represent himself with a concerto already carried out at the time d' a preceding inscription.

Article 7: The contest proceeds in the following way: Quarterfinal: 1 free work and 1 imposed work. Semi-final: 1 free work different from the preceding one. Public finale: 1 concerto for piano and orchestra with the choice among the concertos suggested in the musical program.

Article 8: The title of l' work imposed will be communicated on October 1, 2008 (cf programs musical).

Article 9: The tests of the Contest will be carried out of memory.

Article 10: A jury made up professional musicians as well as First Grand Prix of the preceding contest, which sits of right, allots the prices. Moreover, it is proceeded at the time of the finale to a vote of the public which decrees its own price.

Article 11: Each candidate will receive, two weeks before the contest, the precise details concerning the place and the hour of the tests.

Article 12: The contest will proceed on a concert piano in the large Poincare amphitheatre of the Ecole Polytechnique in Palaiseau. Pianos of study will be placed at the disposal of the candidates to train themselves.

Article 13: L' order of passage of the candidates will be drawn with the fate before the first eliminatory test.

Article 14: The decisions of the Jury are without call. The organizing committee reserves the right to make any additional decision relating to the good walk of the Contest.
